caption: [TLDR: Perfume good for the price, one of the staff was condescending and extremely pushy, seemingly incapable of helping customers with recommendations because she herself did not have any knowledge about what she sells]  I have multiple scents from Fragonard and like them quite a bit, that why I was excited to finally visit their physical store in Paris. While I have nothing to complain about the perfume collection, the staff made me feel like I should not have come to this store at all.  After I found an interesting scent, I asked a sale staff there if there is any scent that is similar to this. The lady did not even try to understand what I said, instead she kept pushing me to take the perfume bottle to cashier with her sale ID (I think each sale person receives commission based on how much they sell), and saying random things about the note of the scents. It took almost 5 minutes of explanation for her to understand that I wanted to have more recommendations. She then managed to offer 2 random scents that were not even in the same direction. I tried gave back to her saying it's not what I want because it is not spicy enough, the woman stared back at me and smile mockingly "Oh are you a professional? You were making comment as if you were one!". She then went on and explained that for professional like her, she would never used her nose because she understand the different notes of perfume and it's all in her head, that when she smells things, she uses her imagination instead (whatever the  heck that means). If she can imagine ginger out of rose and recommend it to customer, whatever floats her boat I guess.  I ended up buying the initial scent anyway, because I like it, not that this sale person was any helpful or influenced my buying decision, if any, I considered walking out of store because of her. It was sad that my first visit to Fragonard  Paris turned out this way. My friends were talking with other staff in the store, they sounded nice, helpful and down-to-earth, I considered this is my misfortune of bumping into this saleswoman.  Hey Fragonard, better training for your staff maybe?

Excellent fragrances, perfumes, museum and fun workshop! Found only in France, if you really like it, get a bottle, it'll last a while. The lilac collection is superb, very accurate scent and taste potent too! They're very kind and willing to help you make a deal, especially if you want to buy multiple bottles, even with new acquaintances, and pay separately.
Not much about perfume manufacturing but a shop posing as a museum. They have 12 "unique" perfumes to try out .
This was an interesting museum.  We took the make your own perfume tour. Was a lot of fun. Housed in a beautiful building across from the opera house
Very nice store. Wide range of products. We were able to get the products we require and were very satisfied. Slightly disappointed with the lack of service from some of the staff.

I always love fragonard parfume, always buy when i visited any place in france, more cheaper if you buy 5 pieces, they didnt gave parfume sample like other places when you buy parfumes and you cant claim tax refund like other place in france if you buy more than 176 euro but i love fragonard parfume long lasting and really unique
Very good and cheap perfumes. Didn't visit museum, will surely love to visit it next time. But the fragrances are pretty awesome. Bought five perfumes which are liked by family nd friends.
Very cosy. Very descreet. It is what we need in Paris: less tourists- more time and individual approach.
Very knowledgeable and friendly staff.  Great perfume products and selections.  Smells great!

The idea of having the museum of perfumes is great, but what ruined the whole experience for me was busyness. The people are constantly crowding the museum and the shop, and make it impossible to actually try some of the perfumes in peace. They have a cool collection of different artifacts but I'd rather lay for the tour, have more breathing room and perhaps try some of the scents as part of the exhibit.

Perfect place to learn about parfumes, its history and how are made today. You will also have the ability to try some of the parfumes and buy them for really good price, so don't hesitate to take them home and make everyone jealous with some of the best quality parfume.
good attitude! the japanese lady is kind but it seems that shes having difficulty speaking french or english.another ladys suggestions are quite helpful and i bought the first parfum in my life here.

Very good place to buy some french perfumes. Rates are moderate. Shop people are well known about perfumes and if you are new they will help you better. Other than perfumes sops and shower gels are also available.

I paid for a mini workshop and guided museum tour. We got pushed past the museum and into what seemed to be a sales pitch. No workshop or museum tour. I asked for my money back and never heard from the place.
Amazing collection of perfumes along with a lesson on perfume making if you are interested.

My expectations were slightly higher to the Perfume Museum, well in reality this is a perfume shop with one room of perfume artefacts... nothing else, a little dissapointment for myself but on the other hand this is a clever Marketing strategy for Fragonard... great job done by someone from Marketing Department
The museum was nice (and free), but the staff in the shop completely ignored me and didn't even try to assist me
Must see perfume museum, ask for a guided tour.
We had a guided tour during Paris visit. They explained the process of perfume making. They have a shop section where they offer various kind of perfumes and other toiletries.
It's good that you can sample. But you can get all the their product from Amazon in US with similar price. So it's kind of unnecessary if you want bring it back as an special gift.
We went and had an amazing experience the workers were very knowledgeable and funny! And the perfume… it was out of this world!!

The museum was interesting and the visit was was free, but the perfume too expensive taking into consideration that it doesn' t persist too much on the skin . I could have bought better perfumes at this price !!
I liked the guided tour with all the explanations about parfum making. I the shop there is a large choice of good quality parfums and cosmetics with reasonable price.
Don’t bother visiting this place. The customer service is rubbish and the cashiers live up to the French stereotype.
Amazing tour of perfumery and history of fragrance. Afterwards rewarded with sampling scents exclusive to France!
Fragonard has locations in Paris, Grasse, and Eze. In Grasse, you'll find their headquarters, a factory, and a larger perfume museum. Worth to visit.....
Love the products by Fragonard. Found them in Nice last summer and ever since I try to find new supply whenever I can.
One star because I came all the way to here and it was closed although it is showing open in google map. 👎🏻 …
Best perfume shopping
Fantastic,  the perfume is really nice. You should've gone and try
Must visit place if you are looking for a unique perfume from Paris.
A must if you love perfumes and enjoy beautiful fabrics.
A must visit when in Paris . You may not buy any perfume but the history of the perfume and the demo is good  .
Great parfume for present and for yourself. Museum also very interesting
A very nice place. Smells awesome. Top customer service
Actually purchased some perfume here in July 2013.  Plan to purchase more when it's done.
The best  you can buy cheeper than other stores in paris.
Nice shop..good demo..very nice scents
